topic.title: HP Helion Openstack Carrier Grade (Beta): Cold Migrate an Instance

body.p: Users can migrate or live migrate an instance as needed.

Migration enables an administrator to move a virtual-machine instance from one compute host to another. This feature is useful when a compute host requires maintenance. Migration can also be useful to redistribute the load when many VM instances are running on a specific physical machine.
Cold migration causes the instance to be shut down for a period of time to be moved to another hypervisor. In this case, the instance recognizes that it was rebooted.

ul.li: Live migration. Almost no downtime. Useful when the instances must be kept running during the migration. For more information, see Live Migration of Virtual Machines.

section.title: Migrate an instance on an hLinux server
section.p: Instances on hLinux servers can be migrated

li.p: Launch the HP Helion Openstack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances link.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to migrate, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Migrate Instance.
In the Confirm Migrate Instance screen, select Migrate Instance.

section.title: Migrate an instance on a Wind River Linux server
section.p: Instances on Wind River Linux servers can be migrated

li.p: Launch the HP Helion Openstack Horizon Dashboard.
Click the Admin dashboard, then the System panel, then the Instances link.
In the Instances screen, for the instance you want to migrate, click the arrow icon in the Actions menu and select Cold Migrate Instance.
In the Confirm Cold Migrate Instance screen, select Cold Migrate Instance.
